brief_summary.textblock:
The study is to show the prognostic factor of HRV parameter and cardiac fibrosis markers in
      critical illness patients

clinical_study.brief_title: The Analysis of Heart Rate Variability With 24hrs Holter ECG and Serum Cardiac Fibrosis Markers in Critical Illness Patients Who Are With Cardiogenic Shock, With ECMO or IABP Support, or With APACH II Score >25)

detailed_description.textblock:
The analysis of Heart Rate Variability with 24hrs Holter ECG and serum cardiac fibrosis
      markers in critical illness patients who are with cardiogenic shock, with ECMO or IABP
      support, or with APACH II score >25)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  critical illness patients who are with cardiogenic shock, with ECMO or IABP support,
             or with APACH II score >25)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  pacemaker rhythm, not sign the permit

clinical_study.official_title: The Analysis of Heart Rate Variability With 24hrs Holter ECG and Serum Cardiac Fibrosis Markers in Critical Illness Patients Who Are With Cardiogenic Shock, With ECMO or IABP Support, or With APACH II Score >25)

primary_outcome.description:
Outcome measurement:
The measure is a composite outcome measure consisting of multiple measures (results to be reported as a single value for each Arm/Group), no changes are required
List the primary condition or disease being studied Shock needing ECMO support
primary_outcome.measure: Heart Rate Variability and serum cardiac fibrosis markers in critical illness patients

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
